overview:
Jeff Herzog is the founder and CEO of ZOG Digital, a search and social optimization and technology company. Herzog (born June 15, 1969 in Perth Amboy, New Jersey) is an American Internet Entrepreneur recognized for founding iCrossing, a digital marketing company based in Scottsdale, Arizona.

Herzog received his B.A. from American University in 1991. In 1998, he undertook his first entrepreneurial venture with iCrossing. Over a 10 year span as its CEO, iCrossing acquired five domestic and international companies including Virginia based Proxicom, UK based Spannerworks and Germany based 3GNet. The company also assembled a client list that included more than 40 Fortune 500 companies and employed more than 600 people.

Herzog has been listed in the New York Ten Awards and B2B Magazine’s “Who’s Who” in business. He was named to the Executive Council of New York’s list of the “10 Most Prominent Innovators,” and was a finalist for the Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year.

In 2008, Herzog founded ZOG Media. ZOG Media is the parent company of ZooLoo.com, ZOG Names, Z Audience and ZOG Digital. ZooLoo.com is an online environment. ZOG Names is an ICANN accredited domain registrar and Z Audience is an advertising platform.
